questiontext.text:
We often wish to simplify an expression involving logarithms. In order to do this we use the log laws above in order to combine logs.


Example

Simplify: \(\log_{10}2-\log_{10}4+\log_{10}(4^2)+\log_{10}(\frac{10}{4})\).

Solution

The third term \(\log_{10}(4^2)\) simplifies to \(2\log_{10}4\) and the last term \(\log_{10}\left(\dfrac{10}{4}\right)=\log_{10}10-\log_{10}4=1-\log_{10}4\). So the given expression equals

\[\log_{10}2-\log_{10}4+2\log_{10}4+1-\log_{10}4 = \log_{10}2+1.\]
